election_record.label: New York 1807 State Senate, Western District

overview.note: In the official canvass of votes, returns from Hartford in Ontario county were rejected. As such, the official returns list 13441 votes for Alexander Rea, 13407 votes for William Floyd, 11395 votes for Caleb Hyde, and 11267 votes for Moss Kent in the Western District.

sub_unit.name: Allegany
sub_unit.note: Angelica was the only town in Allegany county in 1807.

sub_unit.name: Angelica
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, list 38 votes for Caleb Hyde and 37 votes for Moss Kent in Angelica.

sub_unit.name: Broome
sub_unit.note: Scattering votes in Tioga and Broome counties were listed together.
Moss Kent received 1 vote as Moses Kent.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 249 votes for Moss Kent in Broome county.

sub_unit.name: Brutus
sub_unit.note: Moss Kent received 2 votes as Moses Kent.

sub_unit.name: Chenango
sub_unit.note: William Floyd received 5 votes as William Loyd.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 1177 votes for Alexander Rea and 1156 votes for William Floyd.

sub_unit.name: Northampton
sub_unit.note: The Western Repository, May 5, lists 90 votes for Moss Kent and 92 votes for Caleb Hyde in Northampton.

sub_unit.name: Willink
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 22, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 29, list 16 votes for Moss Kent in Willink.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 19; the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 18; the Columbian Gazette, May 12; New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 20; and the New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 23, list 1105 votes for Alexander Rea, 1101 for William Floyd, and 614 votes for Caleb Hyde in Herkimer county. The town votes listed, though, add up to the totals listed here.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 1100 votes for William Floyd in Herkimer county.

The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, list 1100 votes for Alexander Rea, 1098 votes for William Floyd, 614 votes for Caleb Hyde, and 589 votes for Moss Kent in Herkimer county.
William Rea received 2 votes as William Ray.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: Moss Kent received 7 votes as Moses Kent.
John Broome received 1 vote as John Broom.
Scattering votes for Jefferson, Lewis, and Saint Lawrence counties were listed together.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 21 and June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, list 693 votes for William Floyd in Jefferson county.

sub_unit.name: Lewis
sub_unit.note: Scattering votes for Jefferson, Lewis, and Saint Lawrence counties were listed together.

sub_unit.name: Oneida
sub_unit.note: Moss Kent received 5 votes as Moses Kent.

The Columbian Gazette, May 12; New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 23; and New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 20, list 1761 votes for Alexander Rea and 1651 votes for Caleb Hyde in Oneida couty.
The Patriot, May 12, lists 175

sub_unit.name: Redfield
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette, May 12; The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 14; the New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 20; and the New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 23, list 52 votes for Alexander Rea in Redfield.

sub_unit.name: Remsen
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette, May 12, the New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 20, and the New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 23, list 2 votes for Caleb Hyde in Remsen.
The New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 23, lists 6 votes for Alexander Rea in Remsen.

sub_unit.name: Rome
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette, May 12; The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 14; New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 20; and the New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 23, list 133 votes for Alexander Rea in Rome.

sub_unit.name: Sangerfield
sub_unit.note: The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 20, lists 215 votes for Moss Kent in Sangerfield.

sub_unit.name: Verona
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette, May 12; The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 14; New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 20, and the New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 23, list 77 votes for Alexander Rea in Verona.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: Moss Kent received 6 votes as Moses Kent.
William Floyd received 4 votes as William F. Floyd and 1 vote as Williams Floyd.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, list 1287 votes for Alexander Rea in Onondaga county.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 29, lists 1065 votes for Caleb Hyde in Onondaga county.

sub_unit.name: Cicero
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 2, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 29, list 37 votes for William Floyd in Cicero.

sub_unit.name: Lysander
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 2, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 29, list 8 votes for Moses Kent in Lysander.

sub_unit.name: Manlius
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 2, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 29, list 160 votes for William Floyd in Manlius.

sub_unit.name: Ontario
sub_unit.note: Newspaper sources list 1503 votes for Caleb Hyde and 1571 votes for Moss Kent in Ontario county, though the town votes add up to 1506 and 1572, respectively.

sub_unit.name: Hartford
sub_unit.note: The returns from Hartford were rejected in the Official Canvass of Votes.

sub_unit.name: Pittstown
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 29, list 152 votes for Caleb Hyde in Pittstown.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: One vote for William Floyd in Otsego county was listed among the scattering votes.
The Otsego Herald (Cooperstown, NY) lists 1892 votes for William Floyd in Otsego county, though the town votes listed add up to 1792.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, list 1785 votes for William Floyd in Otsego county.

sub_unit.name: Saint Lawrence
sub_unit.note: Scattering votes for Jefferson, Lewis, and Saint Lawrence counties were listed together.

The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 21 and 26, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 22, list 91 votes for William Floyd in Saint Lawrence county.

sub_unit.name: Hopkinton
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 9, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 12, list 17 votes for Caleb Hyde in Hopkinton.

sub_unit.name: Seneca
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, list 8 votes for Caleb Sampson in Seneca county.

sub_unit.name: Tioga
sub_unit.note: Scattering votes in Tioga and Broome counties were listed together.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 174 votes for Moss Kent in Tioga county.
Moss Kent received 2 votes as Ross Kent.

election_record.reference: New-York Evening Post (New York, NY). May 20, 1807.
Smith, James H. History of Chenango and Madison Counties New York. Syracuse, NY: D. Mason and, 1880. 578.
